item.title: What Causes Eye Floaters in Young Adults?
item.description:
You’re young. You’re healthy. And suddenly — you’re seeing weird little floaty specks or strings in your vision.

So naturally, your brain goes:

“Wait… am I too young for eye floaters?”

The truth? Eye floaters can absolutely show up in your teens, twenties, or thirties.
And no, it doesn’t automatically mean something serious is wrong.

Let’s break down what causes eye floaters in young adults, when to worry, and how to stop spiraling over something your brain can adapt to.
